channel.title: Authenticate on Hugo Techdoc Theme
channel.description: Recent content in Authenticate on Hugo Techdoc Theme

item.title: Decide on a sign-in solution
item.description: Decide which sign-in solution is right for you Click here to give feedback about this page Content Notes Target personas: WIC App Developer,Experienced IAM developer Changes to be made: - Update title Links to original docs: - Okta deployment models - redirect vs. embedded: https://developer.okta.com/docs/concepts/redirect-vs-embedded/ Content type: Guide Hub A guide hub is the main navigation page for a section, such as learn, plan, or build. It begins with “Who this section is for?

item.title: Add the recommended sign-in solution: redirect model
item.description: Add the recommended sign-in solution: redirect model Click here to give feedback about this page Content Notes Target personas: WIC App Developer,Experienced IAM developer Changes to be made: In phase 1 if “Setting up okta org policies” can be unified into one place for all (redirect and embedded) guides, we’ll have to add a specific set up guides for redirect and each of the embedded models. Why is this here?: Based on GroupIt Oktane user research, customers seem confused of what Redirect model means.

item.title: Add a more customizable sign-in solution
item.description: Add a more customizable sign-in solution Click here to give feedback about this page Content Notes Target personas: WIC App Developer,Experienced IAM developer Content type: Dynamic Index A dynamic index is an automatically generated list of links to topics immediately beneath it based purely on the site’s structure, or with some level of filtering. A blind list of summaries and links to child docs. For example: https://developer.okta.com/docs/guides/authorization/ https://developer.okta.com/docs/guides/api-security/ https://developer.okta.com/docs/guides/manage-users/

item.title: Add a sign-in experience directly with Okta API
item.description: Add a sign-in experience directly with the Direct Authentication API Click here to give feedback about this page Group Notes Group description: This group contains all the Direct Auth integration guides. This section was created by pulling on the dimensions of the doc into separate guides in the new IA. This was done for several reasons: See the “Notes” tab on dimension rules. Content Notes Target personas: WIC App Developer,Experienced IAM developer

item.title: Eliminate duplicate factor challenges with AMR
item.description: Eliminate duplicate factor challenges with AMR Click here to give feedback about this page Content Notes Target personas: WIC App Developer,Experienced IAM developer Changes to be made: - Update title Update Plant UML flowcharts Links to original docs: - Configure AMR claims mapping: https://developer.okta.com/docs/guides/configure-amr-claims-mapping/main/ Content type: Integration guide An integration guide or coding guide illustrates how to perform a specific task that involves writing code. It is similar to a how-to but the focus is more technical and geared towards developers integrating an SDK, API, or another library into their applications.

item.title: Add a sign-in solution to an input constrained device (e.g. Apple TV)
item.description: Add a sign-in solution to an input constrained device (e.g. Apple TV) Click here to give feedback about this page Content Notes Target personas: WIC App Developer,Experienced IAM developer Changes to be made: - This guide contains reference endpoint information that needs to be stripped out of this guide and placed under the API reference if it doesn’t exist. Understand which auth solution this is for: redirect, embedded, SDKS, API, or a combination of all three.

item.title: Add a browser sign-in solution for mobile devices
item.description: Add a browser sign-in solution for mobile devices Click here to give feedback about this page Content Notes Target personas: WIC App Developer,Experienced IAM developer Changes to be made: - Add a intro paragraph specifically stating what scenarios this implementation is used for. When would i use this scenario over direct auth? We need to make it clear that this is a Non-interaction code implementation Remove “Native” and use Mobile instead.

item.title: Share application key credentials across apps
item.description: Share application key credentials across apps Click here to give feedback about this page Content Notes Target personas: WIC App Developer,Experienced IAM developer Changes to be made: - Update title Need to understand whether i can use this implementation for redirect, embedded, direct auth, etc. After we find out, we’ll update the keywords accordingly and potentially update the guide placement. Links to original docs: - Share application key credentials for IdPs across Apps: https://developer.

item.title: Logout
item.description: Logout Click here to give feedback about this page Content Notes Target personas: WIC App Developer,Experienced IAM developer Content type: Dynamic Index A dynamic index is an automatically generated list of links to topics immediately beneath it based purely on the site’s structure, or with some level of filtering. A blind list of summaries and links to child docs. For example: https://developer.okta.com/docs/guides/authorization/ https://developer.okta.com/docs/guides/api-security/ https://developer.okta.com/docs/guides/manage-users/
